intro: Melancranis acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed melancranis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences of white or pale green flowers, which bloom in early spring. Its roots are tuberous and often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
